result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary R. Blanski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary R. Blanski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary R. Blanski was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Gary R. Blanski was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Gary R. Blanski was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz McGrath. Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on DE's motion and upon hearing arguments only the $95,000 posted on 5/7/15 between 11CT342, 13CM323, 14CF303 and 15CF353 is reinstated and no longer forfeited.  Amended Complaint filed by the State and case is resolved.  Counts 1, 4 and 6 - DE pleads Guilty per amended complaint; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3 and 5 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.
Count 1- DE is sentenced to 360 days in the KCJ forthwith with credit for 175 days.  Huber & Work Crew privileges are authorized, but DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Fined $3600 plus costs and Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  
Counts 4 and 6 - DE is sentenced to 9 months in the KCJ concurrent to Count 1.  Court costs to be taken from bond posted.
Any other bonds that were posted and forfeited aside from 5/7/15 remain forfeited at this time.  Atty Hertz-McGrath states she will provide proof regarding prior counsel's advise to the DE and requests remaining forfeited amounts be reconsidered and court will review at that time.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock ordered.
Motion date of 9/10 at 2PM confirmed with Atty Hertz-McGrath in courtroom.
Email correspondence received from Atty Hertz-McGraths Office date not yet confirmed.
Motion scheduled 9/10/15 at 2:00 PM pending confirmation from Atty Hertz-McGrath.
to Vacate Bond Forfeitures filed by Atty Hertz-McGrath
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorney filed by Atty Hertz-McGrath
Filed by Atty D Hertz-McGrath.
Scheduling Order

11CT342/13CM323/14CF303/14CF414/14CF1299/15CF353/15CF451
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Olson questions validity of DE's convictions and Atty Binger states he will obtain certified copies to substantiate his out of county convictions.  Cases are not resolved at this time and scheduling order is given to parties.  11CT342 is set for trial and other files will trail.  Atty Olson requests DeNovo Review be held over to the next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. J. Eric Olson. Clerk LE. Case trails 14CF1299, 15CF353, 15CF451. Judicial pretrial on 6-25-15 @ 8:50am. Bond continues to be denied.
for DeNovo Review of Commissioner David Berman's 5/15/15 Order Forfeiting Bond filed by Atty Olson.
